text.content: I recently included notion in my website’s stack as a headless CMS. This is an example blogpost that exemplifies some of blocks that are supported.

rich_text.plain_text: I recently included notion in my website’s stack as a headless CMS. This is an example blogpost that exemplifies some of blocks that are supported.

text.content: All Notion supported titles (H1, H2 and H3) are linked with a reference so you can share specific sections of the article. Look out for an upcoming table of contents 🙄

text.content: , and can even be used to add super indexes with a footnote reference

text.content: Callouts are supported! But Notion’s API does not retrieve it’s color...

rich_text.plain_text: Callouts are supported! But Notion’s API does not retrieve it’s color...

text.content: Now Notion’s API does support block background colors – they were not back when we wrote the above callout

text.content: You can try checking or unchecking these ☝️ in the website interface – it won’t work! Ha! Why would you want it to anyways? This is a static page.

text.content: If you really want to escape the things that harass you, what you’re needing is not to be in a different place but to be a different person
